Publication.Title: The Silmarillion
Publication.Author: John Ronald Reuel Tolkien
Publication.Description:
Novel titled: 'The Silmarillion' written by: John Ronald Reuel Tolkien in 1977 Genre: Fantasy
Collection of J. R. R. Tolkien's mythopoeic works, edited and published posthumously by his son, Christopher Tolkien. The Silmarillion, though incomplete, describes the universe of Eä in which are found the lands of Valinor, Beleriand, Númenor, and Middle-earth within which The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings take place.

Publication.Title: Hamlet
Publication.Author: William Shakespeare
Publication.Description:
Drama titled: 'Hamlet' written by: William Shakespeare First played in: 1603
Set in the Kingdom of Denmark, the play dramatises the revenge Prince Hamlet is called to wreak upon his uncle, Claudius, by the ghost of Hamlet's father, King Hamlet. Claudius had murdered his own brother and seized the throne.

Publication.Title: The Shining
Publication.Author: Stephen King
Publication.Description:
Novel titled: 'The Shining' written by: Stephen King in 1977 Genre: Horror
The Shining centers on the life of Jack Torrance, an aspiring writer and recovering alcoholic who accepts a position as the off-season caretaker of the Overlook Hotel. His family accompanies him on this job, including his young son Danny Torrance, who possesses "the shining", an array of psychic abilities that allow Danny to see the hotel's horrific past.
